page.title: 10GEOGAPHY,ECOLOGY,ENVIROMENT
page.content: Our area is part of one of the five valleys of Stroud along which the River Frome flows. On the north side of the valley a large number of houses have been built. There are fields and woods on the hillside as well. A railway line and a canal also run along the valley. The Stroudwater Canal is now fallen into decay but a band of volunteers are attempting to restore it. The railway runs from Gloucester through Stroud to Swindon. Two woollen mills work to produce cloth for suits, a reminder that the Cotswolds were a centre of wool production in the past. A number of light engineering factories have been built in the area which has encouraged building of houses for those who work there.
